alert.note: Alert for Sierra (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 4:06PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Sierra. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Monument Creek, North Fork Palomas Creek, Willow Creek, Seco Creek, Circle Seven Creek, Honda, Ca√±ada, Morgan Creek, South Fork Cuchillo Negro Creek, Cuchillo Negro Creek, Palomas Creek, North Prong Circle Seven Creek, South Fork Palomas Creek, Salado Creek, Cherry Creek and Indian Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hermosa, San Miguel and Chise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying spots.
